entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 5:09AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog and Freezing Fog will continue across portions of the Tennessee Valley this morning... Patchy Dense Fog and Freezing Fog will continue to impact much of the region early this morning, and although visibility reductions will be more common across northeast Alabama and southern Middle Tennessee, some fog has recently developed across northwest Alabama.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Colbert; Cullman; DeKalb; Franklin; Jackson; Lauderdale; Lawrence; Limestone; Madison; Marshall; Morgan

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 1:14AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LIGHT SNOW MAY IMPACT MOUNTAIN TRAVEL THIS EVENING... * Fast moving storm will bring a period of light snow above 6500 feet elevation from late afternoon into the evening. Highest chances for snow are between 5 to 10 PM. * Sierra passes such as Donner, Echo, Yuba, and Mt Rose could see slick travel conditions this evening, including the commute.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued December 26 at 1:11PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT: MANDATORY WOOD-BURNING BAN IN EFFECT... The South Coast AQMD has extended a mandatory wood-burning ban for residents in the South Coast Air Basin for Tuesday and Wednesday. No-Burn days are declared to protect public health when levels of fine particle air pollution in the region are forecast to be high. Smoke from wood burning can cause health problems. Breathing high
entry.cap:areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; Orange County Inland; Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 4:07AM CST until December 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Will Continue in Southwest and South Central Iowa Today... .Light snow with short periods of heavier snow today. Accumulations of 1 to 3 inches are possible on grassy and elevated surfaces. With warmer road temperatures most snow will melt on roadways, though slushy accumulation is possible especially on bridges and overpasses.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 3:44AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SLICK SPOTS ON AREA ROADS THIS MORNING... Snow shower activity may cause brief ice accumulations on area roads and sidewalks. If you travel, please use caution and allow extra time to reach your destination.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 4:54AM MST until December 27 at 9:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Light snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Nebraska, Banner, Kimball, and Cheyenne County. In
